document.title: WISCONSIN ESSENTIAL ELEMENTS FOR English Language Arts

44062CEE22244B8D921C3AEFDDA1B307.description:
Consult print in the environment to
support reading and spelling.

2EC71BCF25624BA091ECD917F811035A.description:
Identify printed rhyming words with
the same spelling pattern.

0BD23FDD39FD4330AAFA445A3E6A67E4.description:
With guidance and support,
capitalize the first letter of familiar
names.

3AA6A8A3C4D8410CB1B229146D6C9120.description:
Demonstrate emerging
understanding of conventions of
standardized English.

87ABE90B850248B6BF1D4E73331E5AA7.description:
Combine two or more words
together in communication.

840F10C748E348CA89A13CB21C356256.description:
Use frequently occurring pronouns
to refer to self and others (e.g., we,
they, him, her, them).

25F45363AEA944958A5347B01E020227.description:
Use common nouns (e.g., mom, dad,
boy, girl) in communication.

B1A484322BB343A89316F437A192CF1B.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
letter and word use.

079591D24EBA4567B7480FDFE0F9133D.description:
Use words acquired through
conversations, being read to, and during
shared reading activities.

A7EA4D130B7B467E9ED87D8ABE6A7F97.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the
meaning of common verbs.

6C45DD3D48C54D2FBE67F79D1752A8CC.description:
Identify real-life connections
between words and their use (e.g.,
happy: “I am happy.”).

E62112276118420F8B097CE0092A3F93.description:
With guidance and support, identify
rhyme and repetition (letters,
words, or phrases)

11D448EAEB0E4361B447AF793963F999.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
word relationships and use.

9A9FA1177CC945658AE758E20E577727.description:
Identify the words comprising
compound words.

64283C5B15E548519B6ED4893B63E3E0.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of new
vocabulary drawn from reading and
content areas.

3C5DE375AFF14BB296F611E6AF04A4E1.description:
Notice formal and informal uses of
language.

FF50342DB1D34F37B1D44FFF35BB51EE.description:
Use language to achieve desired
outcomes when communicating.

24040A7471DE4FE1860E1CFD8F692803.description:
Select visual, audio, or other digital
media, and/or tactile representations to
depict a personal experience.

1D2BAD710FD14188AB73CEC4B29DA743.description:
Identify a photograph or object
that reflects a personal experience and tell
one detail about it.

D8117796D3E84274A32BB9786392993D.description:
Ask and answer questions about
the details provided by the speaker, or
expand on the topic.

C8F56AADB9ED4697B26292DE3E8B701C.description:
Demonstrate an emerging
understanding of a familiar text read aloud
or information presented orally or through
other media by answering questions.

E343EC7806E847F28BC81143A44E8848.description:
Consider individual differences
when communicating with others.

1B56A9E0CCB74EBE8C94D222E7BF9DC9.description:
Ask for clarification and further
explanation as needed about the
topics and texts under discussion.

A8A7403C35F64898A17BE3A839811484.description:
Engage in multiple-turn exchanges
with peers with support from an
adult.

2B7C243CB6094B84B74A72EB90DEFD5B.description:
With guidance and support,
participate in conversations with adults and
peers.

34B608CB8C1148D7A5967D4CB302050E.description:
With guidance and support from
adults, recall key details from literary or
informational texts.

61D30502AEAB4EB29D7944E0702B01F0.description:
Identify information related to
personal experiences and answer simple
questions about those experiences.

8D4378EE18184BF999E22003BAE2A7DF.description:
With guidance and support,
participate in shared and independent
inquiry and writing projects.

9F08BCB59B2845DA9157137882C806F6.description:
With guidance and support from
adults and peers, use technology (including
assistive technologies) to produce and
publish writing. Learn to produce writing
through printing (including forming upper
and lower case letters).

7C9E328BBA02486D83BB2C97C55F9BBA.description:
With guidance and support
from adults, focus their own drawing,
dictation, or writing on a topic and add more
details to strengthen their drawing,
dictation, or writing as needed.

366055DDCA544B009B3356FDBDCABDAF.description:
With guidance and support, use
a combination of drawing, dictating and
writing to create a text that uses words
familiar to the student and temporal words
to signal event order.

F64D5E8E9F41420E8D3E1F1FFBA9699C.description:
Convey events, real or imagined
and narrate a single event or
several loosely linked events.
Include some details regarding
what happened.

8450CE84DF204B3D8EF9FC02289C8C9B.description:
Informative/Explanatory text in
which they provide at least 1 fact
about a predetermined or self
chosen topic.

8A8A6769AA484756A7B4D89BD14F410B.description:
Opinion pieces in which they state
an opinion about a topic or text.

2A3037D5098D4E16B6741656432CFBE6.description:
With guidance and support, use
writing, dictation and/or drawing to
compose:

9AC6FF3CD8D6458C85419EE2BA4FC453.description:
With guidance and support, use
drawing, dictating, or writing to compose
writing for a variety of high-stakes and low stakes purposes.

34D7D6FA21A6443D8E03696098C285F6.description:
Identify points the author makes
in text. (RI)

D207AB29970B405BA1DF61FD5EFC6A84.description:
Identify illustrations or
objects/tactile information in text that
depict characters. (RI&RL)

BECE99FC0DCB4E57BDF9DDC131FCC944.description:
With guidance and support,
identify words and graphic representations
that connect to the point of view, topic, or
important details of the text. (RI&RL)

86AFA16018DD48FDA8F3BC4E3E53B360.description:
Identify the beginning and end of
a familiar sequential text (RL) or identify
relevant graphics in an informational text
(RI).

F24E8FB2EAF34DE481ABCC8B493B2228.description:
Use a text’s structure (e.g.,
repetition, rhyming, etc.) to identify specific
content, sensory, or feeling words that
meaningfully relate to the text. (RI&RL)

F55501840F694CA9ACF14D9E1D23A8CE.description:
Identify the actions of characters
(RL) or important details and events (RI) in
familiar and unfamiliar texts.

4827DB8B1F2142E38CE3517F2C02E1CD.description:
Identify the topic of a text(RI) and
use details to recount events from familiar
stories (RL).

FBD60EF5F7134449A272B15843323583.description:
Given guidance and support,
answer “who”, “what” and “where” questions
in familiar texts. (RI&RL)

E59E6757F44B463598B410D5DB2756F2.description:
With support, monitor for and
identify errors that disrupt
comprehension

AC72826689614CFEAD69A54E39DF6027.description:
Read familiar text comprised of
known words.

2AB7BBD3163740E4A5EE1CA54E851C6E.description:
Identify letter sound
correspondence for single
consonants.

B9E9B1A614404329BDB6751DCF2261F8.description:
Identify the lower case letters of the
alphabet.

6416A034C3164F5287D073D0C4B49B7F.description:
Demonstrate emerging use of
letter-sound knowledge to read words.

1011C2990DAA4F7EB7EEB6D352446AB1.description:
With guidance and support, add,
delete and substitute individual
sounds (phonemes) in simple, one syllable words to make new words.

13A404FF3177468C84CF2CC500883C95.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
spoken words, syllables, and sounds
(phonemes).
